NODE_TEXT:
With this setting, the parameters for the discrepancy analysis can be configured.

# Measuring range

The measuring ranges 0 to 20 mA and 4 to 20 mA are available for selection. With 0 to 20 mA, HART communication is not possible.

# F wire-break detection

In the 4 to 20 mA measuring range and with wire-break detection activated, a message is issued when a current of < 3.6 mA is present. If wire-break detection is deactivated, an underflow message is issued if a current of < 0.4444 mA is present (as with the 0 to 20 mA measuring range).

# Filter

The module filters the input signal throughout the specified number of acquisition cycles. Please note that input signal filtering will lengthen the system's reaction time.

Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)

Operating Manual, 04/2018, A5E43228905-AA

# Configuring S7F/FH hardware

# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules

# Discrepancy handling (analog inputs)

In the processing industry, no evaluation is generally performed between 2 signals on the module. 1oo1 is set for sensor evaluation. This makes all the signals available in the user program, where they can be linked in 1oo2 or 2oo3, depending on what is required.
Q: What measuring ranges are available for selection in the discrepancy analysis settings?
A1: The available measuring ranges are 0 to 20 mA and 4 to 20 mA.
A2: You can choose between 0 to 20 mA and 4 to 20 mA for the measuring range.
A3: Options include 0 to 20 mA or 4 to 20 mA.
A4: Two measuring ranges are selectable: 0-20 mA and 4-20 mA.
A5: For discrepancy analysis, the settings allow selection from 0 to 20 mA or 4 to 20 mA ranges.

Q: Is HART communication possible with the 0 to 20 mA measuring range?
A1: No, HART communication is not possible with the 0 to 20 mA measuring range.
A2: HART communication cannot be used when the measuring range is set to 0 to 20 mA.
A3: With 0 to 20 mA selected, HART communication is unavailable.

Q: What happens when wire-break detection is activated in the 4 to 20 mA measuring range and a current of < 3.6 mA is present?
A1: A message is issued when a current of < 3.6 mA is present with wire-break detection activated.
A2: If wire-break detection is on and current drops below 3.6 mA, a notification is sent.
A3: Activated wire-break detection triggers a message for currents under 3.6 mA.
A4: With wire-break detection enabled, currents below 3.6 mA result in a message.
A5: The system alerts you when the current is less than 3.6 mA if wire-break detection is active.

Q: What is the threshold for an underflow message if wire-break detection is deactivated in the 4 to 20 mA measuring range?
A1: An underflow message is issued if a current of < 0.4444 mA is present.
A2: Without wire-break detection, currents below 0.4444 mA trigger an underflow alert.
A3: Deactivating wire-break detection means an underflow message appears for < 0.4444 mA.
A4: The underflow threshold is 0.4444 mA when wire-break detection is off.
A5: If wire-break detection is not active, an underflow is reported at currents under 0.4444 mA.
